custom-action.name: imported_receive_messages
custom-action.description:
Receive Kafka Messages from a topic. More information on all the available parameters can be found here : https://kafka.apache.org/0102/documentation/#consumerconfigs
Possible parameters are: - bootstrap.servers (required): A list of host/port pairs to use for establishing the initial connection to the Kafka cluster such as host1:port1,host2:port2. - topic (required): The topic the record will be consumed from. - group.id (optional): A unique string that identifies the consumer group this consumer belongs to. This property is required if the consumer uses either the group management functionality by using subscribe(topic) or the Kafka-based offset management strategy. - timeout (required): The maximum time to block in ms. Default value is "15000". - key.deserializer (optional): Deserializer class for key that implements the Deserializer interface. Default value is "org.apache.kafka.common.serialization.StringDeserializer". - value.deserializer (optional): Deserializer class for value that implements the Deserializer interface. Default value is "org.apache.kafka.common.serialization.StringDeserializer". - max.poll.records (optional): The maximum number of messages returned in a single call. - failOnTimeout (optional): If set to true, the action fails when timeout is reached. Default value is "true". - close (optional): Whether to close the consumer or not after sending the message. If not closed, the consumer will be kept in the context for the next execution. Default value is "false".
